summary: Congress created the Strategic Petroleum Reserve more than 4 decades ago to release oil during supply disruptions and protect the U.S. economy. In this testimony, we noted that since then, oil has been released 11 times in response to domestic disruptions, including 6 caused by hurricanes. However, the reserve’s ability to respond is limited. We found 3 main reasons: it is almost entirely made up...
title: Strategic Petroleum Reserve: Preliminary Observations on the Emergency Oil Stockpile
